Job Description:
My client is looking for qualified candidates with specialised and deep technical skills acquired through extensive industry experience. Pending experience, the candidate can apply for an Assistant/Manager, Senior or a Lead Professional Officer role.

The successful candidates will be part of their pool of academic staff under the Professional Officers (PO) scheme. They form the talent pool which brings a much-needed industry perspective to student learning. They facilitate applied learning and applied research in the institution, complementing the academic expertise of the faculty to bring industry practices and applications into the curriculum.

Professional Officers leverage on their industry experiences to create authentic learning environments, where discovery and innovation take place. They act as coaches and mentors to students during practical learning activities such as laboratory sessions, Capstone Projects and the work study programme. Professional Officers could also lead or work with faculty on industry innovation projects to provide solutions to the industry.

In addition to their role in applied learning and applied research, Professional Officers manage the centralised laboratory facilities and resources in the institution. With Technical Officers, laboratory safety professionals, and administrators in department, they jointly develop central policies and processes for the safe and seamless operation of laboratories in the institution.

Job Responsibilities
Design and teach labs & practice modules.
Mentor students in Capstone Projects and the work study programme.
Manage labs and equipment to support academic programmes and applied research.
Ensure safety in labs.
Participate and manage the industry project with Principal Investigator (PI), Co-PI and team members to ensure all project deliverables are met.
An innovative mindset in exploration, valuation, and application of new technologies in food product/ process/ packaging research and development.
Involve in customer engagements, includes gathering of systems requirements and formulate scope.
Involve in the full development life cycle, i.e., design, development, and testing.

Job Requirements
A good degree in Food Science and Technology, or a related field. Masters and PhD would be advantageous.
At least 10 or more years of working experience and proven track record of technical expertise with minimum 7 years of R&D experience in food industry.
Excellent knowledge and experience in food ingredients/ packaging/ processing, and their applications in food products.
Excellent understanding in food chemistry / microbiology / texture / sensory evaluation, with discerned laboratory skills for food analysis would be advantageous.
Hands-on experience in quality control and food safety management would be an added advantage.
An innovative mindset in exploration, valuation, and application of new technologies in food product/ process/ packaging research and development.
Experience in writing project grants will be an added advantage.
Extensive experience and knowledge of industry practices to bring industry perspective to the institution.
Keen interest in innovation projects, with demonstrated ability in developing solutions to technical problems.
Strong supervisory skills and enjoy working closely with students in an educational environment.

Interested candidates are invited to submit their MS Word formatted CV with the current and expected salary remunerations.

Job Description:
Elevate Everywhere Work: Senior Enterprise Sales Manager for ASEAN

Ivanti, a billion-dollar organisation with a thrilling growth story. We are actively seeking a dynamic Senior Enterprise Sales Manager to lead our ASEAN business. This pivotal role centres around cultivating the ASEAN market through our channel partnerships. As the Senior Enterprise Sales Manager you will work independently in the region, navigating strategic decisions that shape our success.
Who We Are:
At Ivanti, we champion Everywhere Worka vision where employees effortlessly access IT applications and data across diverse devices and networks. Our global mission is to be a technology leader, automating tasks that discover, manage, secure, and service all IT assets. With offices in 23 nations, including a prominent hub in Seoul, we are committed to delivering world-class solutions for our customers.
What you will do:
Strategic Channel Sales: Directly sell Ivanti Solutions or orchestrate sales through strategic partners within the ASEAN markets.
Architecting Revenue Growth Through Channels: Collaborate seamlessly with the marketing team to execute ingenious marketing plans, propelling Ivanti towards unparalleled revenue growth.
Channel Partner Leadership: Take the lead in implementing a channel strategy alongside defined partners, ensuring robust pipeline generation to fuel our success story.
Trusted Advisor Role: Elevate your status to a trusted advisor by comprehending customer's current and future IT initiatives, strategically driving Ivanti solutions into the marketplace.
Prospect Development: Unearth and cultivate new sales opportunities, establishing continuous revenue streams contributing to Ivanti's enduring success.
Executive Engagement Expertise: Showcase your finesse by orchestrating initial Executive and CxO discussions, positioning Ivanti as the go-to solution for their needs.
Streamlined Sales Process: Seamlessly navigate the sales process, expertly managing opportunities from inception to closure, ensuring a streamlined and successful journey.
Dynamic Account Management: Become a beacon of customer satisfaction through ongoing account management, fostering lasting relationships, and uncovering avenues for additional revenue streams.
To Be Successful in The Role, You Will Have:
Channel-Focused Sales Acumen: Extensive enterprise Software Sales experience, showcasing a rich tapestry of successes and strategic wins with a strong emphasis on channel partnerships.
Major Account Development into ASEAN Market: Demonstrate prowess in major account development, weaving relationships that stand the test of time and contribute to the growth of the enterprise.
Proven Track Record of Success: Commitment to exceeding revenue goals, positioning yourself as a true achiever in the sales domain.
Exceptional Self-Management and Discipline: As the sole representative in the country, this role demands unparalleled motivation, hands-on dedication, and exceptional communication skills. You will be the architect of your success, requiring the ability to reach out, collaborate, and communicate effectively with peers across borders.
Are you ready to be a catalyst for change, leading Ivanti into a new era of success within the Singaporean and ASEAN markets? Join us in shaping the future of enterprise software in APAC! Let's make incredible things happen together.
At Ivanti, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Ivanti believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.
If you require special assistance for the best interview experience, please contact us at recruiting@ivanti.com.

Job Description:
About this role:

Embark on an exciting career journey with Wells Fargo, a prominent global bank recognized for its commitment to innovation and excellence. We're currently seeking a seasoned Senior Specialty Systems Operations Engineer to provide advanced platform support for our Commercial and Corporate & Investment Banking Technology (CCIBT) organization. In this role, you'll have the chance to lead complex initiatives and contribute to the strategic planning of our computer systems and network infrastructure.

As a key member of our team, you'll leverage your expertise to review and analyze complex technical challenges, making decisions on enhancements and improvements to existing systems. Your role will involve collaborating with engineering teams on change design and consulting with technical peers and managers to resolve support issues and drive new initiatives forward. With your solid understanding of technical process controls and standards, you'll play a vital role in shaping the future of our technology landscape.

Led by Sarah Berwick, the Commercial and Corporate & Investment Banking Technology (CCIBT) group supports the Commercial Banking and Corporate & Investment Banking businesses as well as Payment Solutions, Capital Markets Services, Wholesale Digitization, and International Technology across the firm. This diverse portfolio of capabilities spans multiple technology disciplines and strategic innovations. CCIBT provides strategic, enterprise-wide technology capabilities and enabling services to our lines of business and management of the applications in terms of skills, stability, security, scalability, speed, and cost.

Join us at Wells Fargo, where you'll be part of a dynamic and innovative team dedicated to pushing the boundaries of banking technology. This position offers the flexibility of a hybrid work model and is perfect for individuals with a strong background in systems engineering, technology architecture, or related fields. Come be a part of our journey and make your mark in shaping the future of banking technology.
We have multiple opportunities across the following business lines which operate as part of the CCIB business family and are interested to hear about your experience in any of these areas:
Capital Markets
Commercial Lending & Credit Finance
Securities Finance, Coverage & Collateral
Payments & Treasury Management
Wholesale Operations
In this role, you will:
Lead or participate in managing all installed systems and infrastructure, moderately complex application upgrades and vulnerability remediation efforts, within the Systems Operations functional area
Lead team to meet moderately complex technical deliverables while leveraging solid understanding of technical process controls or standards
Act independently as a liaison for the line of business in support of daily inquiries, problem and incident management, project delivery, and escalations by following established guidebooks
Liaise with functional or operational managers to understand their current and future information needs and develop plans and schedules for integrating these needs into existing operations
Recommend solutions to resolve technical issues and achieve highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability by automating platform activities to lower human intervention time on related tasks
Review and analyze moderately complex operational support systems, application software, and system management tools to ensure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability
Facilitate discussions on preventative action, root cause analysis and resolutions with service management
Collaborate and consult with peers, mid-level managers, vendors and other technical personnel to resolve technical issues and achieve highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability and reliability
Provide training and mentoring to lower experienced team members on guidebook changes and lead team to meet technical deliverables, while leveraging solid understanding of technical process controls or standards
Collaborate with development teams to update business continuity plans and provide input on development of new and existing support guidebooks
Required Qualifications:
4+ years of systems engineering or technology architecture experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
4+ years of experience providing monitoring tools support for applications built on JAVA or .NET platforms
3+ years of application production support experience
2+ years of AppDynamic experience
1+ year of Splunk experience
1+ year of Autosys experience
Desired Qualifications:
1+ year of operations environment experience
1+ year of risk and regulatory compliance experience
1+ year of Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF) experience
Ability to interact with all levels of an organization; including management and internal customers
Knowledge and understanding of system monitoring and automation
Knowledge and understanding of network automation development through scripting
Ability to take an active role in the education, mentoring and training team members
Experience with Apache Tomcat, Apache HTTP, IBM Liberty and or WAS, WebLogic, or other similar products on UNIX and or Linux OS
Experience with monitoring tools to solve and prevent application issues
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Leading and resolving major incidents
Job Expectations:
Ability to work on call as assigned
Flexibility to work in a 24/7 environment, including weekends and holidays
Flexibility to adjust work schedule in accordance to the time zone for the market you are supporting

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business units risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Job Description:
Role Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Technical Architect (Infrastructure) to lead, design, and deliver the next stage of our organizations technical infrastructure architecture. The ideal candidate should have a deep understanding of core infrastructure components such as server, storage, database, middleware, and operating systems. Application layer knowledge is beneficial but not the primary focus. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure robust and scalable infrastructure solutions are in place, supporting the organizations strategic initiatives.
Key Responsibilities:
Architectural Leadership:Lead the design, planning, and implementation of advanced infrastructure solutions, ensuring alignment with business goals and long-term IT strategy.
Define technical architecture roadmaps and oversee the transition to next-generation infrastructure.
Infrastructure Design and Optimization:Develop and implement infrastructure designs encompassing server, storage, database, middleware, and OS layers.
Evaluate existing systems and recommend upgrades or replacements to enhance performance, reliability, and scalability.
Technical Expertise:Serve as the subject matter expert on core infrastructure components, providing guidance on best practices, emerging technologies, and industry trends.
Collaborate with application teams to understand infrastructure requirements, focusing on optimizing system-level performance.
Project Management & Delivery:Lead infrastructure projects from concept to delivery, ensuring timely and high-quality execution.
Manage project timelines, resources, and stakeholders, maintaining clear communication throughout the project lifecycle.
Stakeholder Management:Engage with business and technical stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into actionable architecture solutions.
Present technical proposals and solutions to senior leadership in a clear and concise manner.
Security and Compliance:Ensure that infrastructure designs adhere to the organizations security, compliance, and data protection standards.
Incorporate security by design principles into all architectural considerations.
Team Mentorship:Mentor and guide junior architects and technical staff, fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation.
Promote best practices in architecture design and system integration.
Qualifications & Skills Required:
Experience: Minimum 10 years in a technical architect or senior infrastructure role.
Technical Expertise: Strong background in infrastructure architecture, with hands-on experience in:Server Systems (Virtualization, High-Availability Clusters)
Storage Solutions (SAN/NAS, Backup & Recovery, Data Management)
Databases (RDBMS, NoSQL)
Middleware (Web Servers, Integration Platforms)
Operating Systems (Linux/Unix, Windows Server)
Architectural Design: Proven track record in designing and implementing large-scale, complex infrastructure systems.
Leadership: Experience leading architectural design sessions and guiding technical teams.
Communication: Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Certifications: Relevant certifications such as TOGAF, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, or Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert are a plus.
Preferred Attributes:
Strong problem-solving abilities and a forward-thinking approach to infrastructure challenges.
Demonstrated ability to lead multiple projects and prioritize under tight deadlines.
Experience in cloud architecture (AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous.
Why Join Us?
Opportunity to shape and deliver the next-generation infrastructure strategy.
Work with a dynamic and forward-thinking team, focused on innovation and excellence.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in cloud application development, hands-on programming skills, and a strong understanding of cloud architectures and microservices design principles. You will collaborate closely with technical leads and architects to create robust applications and ensure the highest standards of code quality, security, and performance.

Write code that adheres to established design principles, incorporating both static and dynamic code analysis to ensure code quality and security.

Integrate applications with system interfaces, working closely with other teams to ensure seamless communication and data flow between systems.

Golang
Java
Experience in designing and implementing applications based on S.O.L.I.D principles and incorporating unit tests for robust code quality.
Strong understanding and experience with REST API best practices and design guidelines.

FAST API
Flask
Experience with GraphQL is desirable, especially if supporting frontend applications.
Hands-on experience in relational database systems (preferably PostgreSQL).Ability to independently design schema.
Proficiency in using ORM tools and writing plain SQL queries.

Job Description:
SAP PP CONSULTANT

About Axxis Consulting / Company Overview:
We are an SAP Platinum Partner with HQ in Singapore and presence in Malaysia and Japan. Our customers range from Fortune 2000 customers to local SMEs, who we support with SAP S/4HANA, ByD, B1, and CX solutions.
We are growing our regional presence, and we are looking for passionate people to join us for various opportunities. For more information find us at www.axxis-consulting.com.

The Opportunity:
We are looking for experienced individuals to join our delivery team to support the entire life-cycle management of SAP projects - from presales to implementation, from process design to training and post-live support.
As the SAP PP Consultant, you will be working together with an international team of SAP experts, to implement SAP ERP solutions to clients in Singapore and abroad. You will work closely with our team in Singapore, Malaysia, and potentially Japan to assist clients in the deployment of SAP S/4HANA.

This is what you will do:
Participate and be responsible for your area of expertise in full cycle project implementation, as well as support and enhancement projects
Evaluate clients current business processes and make recommendations based on best business practices to resolve business problems
Conduct user requirement gathering and develop function design specifications in alignment with new business requirements
Perform system configuration and documentation, prepare unit testing script and carry out user-acceptance testing, provide post-live support and conduct key-user training

These are your qualifications:
Full-life cycle project experience in implementing SAP S/4HANA
In-depth configuration know-how in your respective area of expertise (SAP PP)
Ability to understand business requirements, identify solutions and communicate best business practices to clients in efforts to minimize modifications and customizations of the Software
Excellent presentation and communications skills to interact successfully with Key Users and Senior Management of multi-national customers.
Good business know-how and solid understanding of Supply Chain and Production Planning Issues and Manufacturing processes
Strong knowledge in Product Costing, Materials and Orders Planning and Scheduling
Minimum of 4 years SAP ERP / ECC / S/4HANA experience in implementing and supporting customers over multiple projects
Relevant SAP Certification is an advantage

Job Description:
Job Title: Level 1 Support Technician
Purpose of the Role
The Level 1 Support Team provides critical front-line support across all aspects of infrastructure. Working as part of a global team, they are responsible for:
Pro-active monitoring of infrastructure.
Performing initial triage of alerts and inbound support requests.
Creating and assigning support cases to the Level 2 operational support teams.
This is a client-facing role with a high level of interaction, requiring the delivery of high-quality service and support. In addition to day-to-day activities, there are opportunities to be involved in internal projects and initiatives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated interest in Technology and Finance.
Responsibilities and Duties (include but are not limited to):
Monitoring & Alerts:Monitor various alert systems and the Service Operations email, and respond to the Service Operation hotline.
Issue Recording:Record all issues within the internal CRM system.
Problem Determination:Provide first-level problem determination/triage on all issues (network/systems/application).
Client Interaction:Acknowledge and resolve clients inquiries and issues within the prescribed Operational Level Agreement (OLA).
Collaboration & Escalation:Engage the relevant Subject Matter Experts and other Service Operation personnel to ensure issues are resolved within the agreed SLA escalation matrix.
Communication:Interface with clients, vendors, market participants, and financial exchanges.
Manage formal communications to clients.
Performance Reporting:Generate statistics on issues raised, resolved, time to resolution, and other Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
Team Engagement:Foster open communication between team members and managers, promoting ideas for improving service delivery.
24x7 Support Coverage:Work as part of a global team that provides 24x7 Level 1 Support coverage on a rotation basis.
Education, Skills, and Background (Including Education and Experience Requirements):
2+ years of experience in a similar customer-facing role.
Degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related discipline.
Experience in a financial industry support role preferred.
Excellent verbal and written English-language communication skills to manage customer relationships effectively.
Strong process discipline with a working knowledge of Salesforce or other CRM systems.
Working knowledge of Linux & Windows systems, network configuration, and general troubleshooting.
Ability to work constructively as part of a team, sharing ideas and resources.
Desirable Skills:
ITIL certification.

Job Title: Sap Fico And Treasury Support Consultant
Job Description:
The candidate must have experience on implementation of treasury related functions and SAP interfaces with bank.
The SAP / bank integration implementation experience is mandatory.

Period: ASAP till 31 Dec 2025, potentially extendable
Start date: ASAP

Job Description:
The support consultant is responsible for the configuration, implementation, and troubleshooting of the financial modules within the SAP system. The primary areas of focus include Accounts Payable, Procurement to Pay, payment instruction to bank, bank statement processing, treasury, vendor business partner management and analysis.

Key Responsibilities:
1. Configuration and implementation of the SAP FICO modules, including General Ledger, Accounts Payable, Controlling, Treasury, etc.
2. Analyze business requirements and translate them into appropriate configuration settings within the SAP FICO system.
3. Perform comprehensive testing of the configured FICO modules to ensure accuracy and functionality.
4. Provide support and troubleshooting for Accounts Payable-related issues, such as vendor master data maintenance, invoice processing, and payment processing.
5. Responsible in the Procurement to Pay process, from purchase requisition, purchase order, invoice management to bank payment.
6. Work with bank solution to implement SAP Treasury related functions or payment interfaces.
7. Set up and maintain the bank statement processing functionality, ensuring accurate and timely reconciliation of bank transactions.
8. Troubleshooting experience on the bank payment instruction process, ensuring compliance with financial institution requirements.
9. Manage the vendor business partner lifecycle, including vendor creation, maintenance, and performance evaluation.
10. Develop and generate financial reports and analyses to support decision-making processes.
11. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as IT, business analysts, and end-users, to address FICO-related issues and provide training.
12. Participate in project planning, documentation, and knowledge transfer activities.
13. Stay up-to-date with the latest SAP FICO functionalities, patches, and best practices.

Required Qualifications:
 Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Business IT.
 Minimum 3-5 years of experience as an SAP FICO Consultant.
 Proven expertise in the configuration and implementation of SAP FICO modules, including Accounts Payable, Procurement to Pay, bank statement processing, bank payment instruction, treasury, and vendor business partner management.
 Have global SAP implementation experience on FICO and Treasury.
 Support experience on Kyriba Treasury functions will be added advantage.
 Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
 Experience in project management and implementation methodologies.
 Certification in SAP FICO or relevant SAP modules is preferred.

Job Description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a Senior MLOps Engineer to lead the development, deployment, and management of machine learning systems and infrastructure. This role requires a blend of expertise in machine learning, cloud platforms, and DevOps practices. You will work closely with data scientists and engineers to ensure the smooth operation and scalability of ML models.

Responsibilities
Design, implement, and manage scalable deployment pipelines for machine learning models using tools like Kubernetes, Docker, and cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Build and maintain robust infrastructure for model training, serving, and monitoring. Ensure systems are reliable, secure, and cost-efficient.
Optimize end-to-end ML workflows and pipelines, including data preprocessing, model training, and deployment. Implement automated CI/CD processes for ML models.
Work with data scientists to understand model requirements and provide support for integrating models into production systems. Collaborate with engineering teams to align on infrastructure needs.
Develop and implement monitoring and logging solutions to track model performance, system health, and operational metrics. Address issues and perform troubleshooting as needed.
Ensure ML systems adhere to security standards and best practices. Implement access controls, data protection measures, and compliance with relevant regulations.
Create and maintain detailed documentation for ML systems, processes, and best practices. Share knowledge with team members and contribute to the development of internal guidelines.
Stay current with the latest developments in MLOps, machine learning technologies, and cloud platforms. Evaluate and integrate new tools and techniques to enhance ML operations.
Requirements
8+ years of experience in MLOps or a related field, with a proven track record of deploying and managing ML models in production environments.
Proficiency in ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn), containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes), and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). Experience with DevOps tools and practices.
Strong programming skills in Python and/or other relevant languages.
Deep understanding of ML systems architecture, data pipelines, and model deployment strategies.
Knowledge of container orchestration and infrastructure as code (IaC) tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues and develop effective solutions.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degree is a plus.

Job Description:

Zscaler Engineer is part of the global team that is responsible for managing and configuring Zscaler controls and policies. Monitor and analyze network traffic for potential security threats

5+ years of hands-on experience with Web proxy, Firewalls, zero trust access controls, preferably Zscaler.
Zero-Trust network design, ZPA and ZIA policy management a plus
University Degree. MBA, CISSP, GDSA, or ZTDA are preferred
Advanced knowledge of Proxy Application security related technologies and their functions. (URL Filtering, App Control, DNS Control, Firewall, Data Loss Protection etc.)
Deep understanding of cloud, security, enterprise SaaS and networking protocols.
Advanced event analysis leveraging SIEM tools
Sophisticated incident investigation and response skill set
Advanced log parsing and analysis skill set
Strong oral and written communication skills, attention to detail, and strong organizational skills.

Performance monitoring and maintenance: Monitor model performance and address any issues or anomalies that arise. Continuously improve models by refining algorithms, optimizing code, and incorporating feedback from users and stakeholders.
Data analysis and insights: Perform exploratory data analysis, generate insights, and present findings to stakeholders. Use statistical methods and visualization techniques to communicate complex concepts and patterns effectively.

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also be considered.
At least 2 years experience working in a similar role. Hands-on experience in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models in real-world applications.
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms, techniques, and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).

Solid understanding of Statistical Analysis, Probability Theory, and Hypothesis Testing.
Familiarity with machine learning tools on cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is a plus.
Problem-solving and analytical mindset: Ability to analyze complex problems, break them down into solvable components, and develop innovative machine learning solutions. Strong mathematical and analytical skills are essential.
Communication and collaboration: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively manage multiple priorities.
Adaptability and continuous learning: Willingness to adapt to evolving technologies and learn new tools and techniques. Demonstrated commitment to staying updated with the latest advancements in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Regional Network Engineer (APAC) to join Client's Network Engineering Team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in designing, implementing, and managing Cisco-based networks and a proven track record in network troubleshooting and project management. This role requires advanced expertise in routing and switching protocols, VPN solutions, and firewall management. The candidate will also collaborate closely with stakeholders, act as an escalation point for complex technical issues, and contribute to the organizations strategic network planning and optimization initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:
1. Network Design & Implementation
Design and implement complex network solutions, ensuring alignment with business and technical requirements as part of the Network Engineering Team.
Oversee projects and coordinate with remote vendors and internal staff to ensure smooth execution of network deployments and updates.
2. Advanced Troubleshooting & Support
Serve as an escalation point for resolving complex problems requiring advanced technical knowledge and research capabilities.
Troubleshoot, investigate errors, and perform root cause analysis for issues related to network performance, connectivity, and security.
3. Documentation & Knowledge Sharing
Maintain and update detailed network documentation, including network diagrams, topology maps, and system run books.
Share knowledge by authoring and maintaining technical documentation and system run books to facilitate knowledge transfer across teams.
4. Stakeholder Collaboration & Communication
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and translate network requirements into technical solutions.
Communicate with customers and internal team members throughout project lifecycles, providing regular progress updates via the project management system.
5. Vendor & Compliance Management
Manage vendor relationships, ensuring compliance with licensing agreements, support contracts, and product lifecycle management.
Conduct vendor evaluations to ensure optimal alignment of product capabilities with business needs.
Requirements:
Technical Skills & Expertise
Expert knowledge of Cisco products, including functionality, configuration, and best practices.
Proficiency in key networking protocols and technologies, including:Quality of Service (QoS)
IPSLA
Dynamic Multipoint Virtual Private Network (DMVPN)
WAN, MPLS, SIP, PRI, IPSEC, and Spanning Tree Protocol (STP)
Strong working knowledge of BGP, EIGRP, and OSPF routing protocols.
Experience with Cisco AnyConnect VPN and Microsoft Windows networking configuration and protocols.
Professional Experience
Minimum of five years of experience as a Network Engineer managing Cisco-based networks.
Proven expertise in error investigation, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis in complex networking environments.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, drive tasks to completion, and deliver projects on time.
Preferred Qualifications:
Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification or higher is highly desirable.
5+ years of Cisco experience (routing with OSPF, BGP, EIGRP; switching, DMVPN, IPsec, SSL VPN).
3+ years of firewall experience with Fortinet and Palo Alto.
Experience in the data center industry or familiarity with data center networking best practices.
Knowledge of Cisco DNA Center and Identity Services Engine (ISE) solutions is a plus.
Familiarity with the SolarWinds monitoring platform for network performance tracking and alerting.
Experience with Meraki solutions and management tools.

Job Description:
Frontend Software Engineer (React.JS)

Location: Central
Working Arrangement: Hybrid
Remuneration Package: Up to $6,500 + AWS + Variable Bonus

About Us:
Join our innovative team as a Frontend Software Engineer and make an impact with your ReactJS expertise. We're looking for a creative and motivated individual to drive the development of engaging user interfaces and cutting-edge applications. In this role, you'll collaborate in a vibrant environment, shaping the future of our web applications while ensuring a seamless and enjoyable user experience.

What You'll Do:
Transform Designs into Code: Convert design wireframes and visual mockups into high-quality, responsive code using HTML5, CSS3, and WebSocket.
Develop and Maintain UI Components: Build, test, and maintain dynamic user interface components with a focus on performance and cross-device compatibility.
Enhance UI/UX: Work closely with our design team to refine and enhance the user experience of our applications.
Create Reusable Code: Develop modular and reusable front-end components and libraries to streamline future projects.
API Integration: Connect with RESTful services to ensure smooth and efficient data exchange.
Collaborate Across Teams: Partner with software engineers, business analysts, and architects to design and implement web-based solutions.
Support and Maintenance: Deploy applications, provide ongoing support, and resolve any issues that arise during or after hours as needed.
Optimize Systems: Improve the efficiency of applications, systems, and databases by understanding and enhancing their interdependencies.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and document your recommendations for team and stakeholder review.
Ensure Quality: Follow best practices for high-quality development to deliver solutions on time and to specification.
What We're Looking For:
Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Experience: Proven track record in developing web applications and workflows, with a solid grasp of modern JavaScript frameworks, especially ReactJS.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, WebSocket, and RESTful APIs. Experience with Git for version control and knowledge of CSS pre-processors (SASS, SCSS, LESS) and bundlers (webpack).
Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in a team setting, with strong communication and problem-solving skills.
If you're passionate about frontend development and eager to work in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment, wed love to hear from you!

Job Description:
Regional Cloud Product Manager
Job Overview:
The Regional Cloud Product Manager is responsible for driving the success of cloud products and services in a specific geographic region. This role requires a deep understanding of both global cloud offerings and local market dynamics. The Regional Cloud Product Manager will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that the cloud products meet the needs of regional customers and align with the company's strategic objectives. This position requires both product management expertise and a strong knowledge of cloud platforms, combined with the ability to adapt to regional customer demands and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities:
Regional Product Strategy:
Develop and execute the regional cloud product strategy, ensuring alignment with global product goals and local market needs
Conduct market research to identify regional trends, customer needs, and competitive offerings
Tailor cloud products and services to the regional market, focusing on localization, regulatory compliance, and customer demand.
Customer-Centric Approach:
Build relationships with key regional customers and stakeholders to understand their cloud needs and pain points.
Partner with regional sales teams to drive adoption and growth of cloud products.
Product Development and Launch:
Manage product launches within the region, including go-to-market planning, localization of materials, and product positioning.
Ensure cloud products comply with regional regulations, data privacy laws, and industry standards.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Collaborate with regional marketing and sales teams to ensure successful cloud product rollouts and customer satisfaction.
Participate in regional sales enablement activities, including training and providing product expertise.
Performance and Market Adaptation:
Monitor and analyze product performance in the region and identify opportunities for product optimization and enhancement based on regional performance data.
Adapt global cloud strategies to regional needs to ensure products are competitive and meet customer expectations.

Requirements:
Education & Experience:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field
Proven experience in product management, particularly within the cloud services space (AWS, Google Cloud, Alibaba Cloud etc.)
Experience managing cloud products in a specific region or across multiple regions is highly preferred
Strong understanding of regional cloud infrastructure, market dynamics, and regulatory requirements

Skills:
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple stakeholders and product initiatives
Ability to analyze market data and customer feedback to inform product decisions
Excellent communication and leadership skills
Ability to navigate regulatory and compliance issues relevant to cloud services in the region

Job Description:
Responsibilities
Designing data processing pipelines: PySpark developers design, build, and unit test applications on the Spark framework using Python.
Understanding business logic: PySpark developers understand the core business logic for bug fixes and maintenance.
Interacting with clients: PySpark developers interact with clients to specify user requirements.
Preparing test cases: PySpark developers prepare test cases and test case documents.
Building applications: PySpark developers build applications for batch and streaming requirements.
Using broadcast variables: PySpark developers use broadcast variables to share read-only data across nodes in the cluster.
Identifying lookup tables: PySpark developers identify and broadcast frequently accessed lookup tables or reference data to improve performance.
Developing data processing tasks: PySpark developers develop data processing tasks such as reading data from external sources, merging data, aggregating data, and performing data enrichment.
Skills/Requirement
Must Have Skills:
 Creating high performance PySpark applications which should be able to handle millions of rows from various file format
 Hands on experience in creating PySpark jobs for data transformation and aggregation
 Strong understanding of Hadoop architecture and design best practices
 Evaluate and implement innovative and continuous design improvements to PySpark framework

Job Description:
Our client is a reputed MNC.

Responsibilities:
Facility / Infrastructure Maintenance
Performs specialized preventative and corrective maintenance on-site to critical facility components and/or systems.
Performs moderately difficult repairs, maintenance, installations and on-site inspections to critical facility systems.
Monitors the Building Monitoring System (BMS) and resolves alarms for specialized issues requiring considerable judgement and implications to resolve; follows guidelines on standard procedures and makes recommendations for solutioning.
Operates and maintains plumbing, fire suppression, and life-safety systems.
Implements energy efficiency measures.
Assists team members on coordinating critical infrastructures.
Works on assignments requiring considerable judgment and initiative.
Understands implications of work and makes recommendations for solutions.
Vendor Support
Coordinates and directs vendors on skilled tasks to ensure that maintenance activities are carried out per standards and requirements.
Assists with the creation and submission of scripts for maintenance.
Tracks and implements the work approval process for service providers for critical maintenance (including briefing at the start of work, control of work during the day workday/shift, final review of the work carried out).
In cooperation with the vendors, changes/updates technical files for plants and equipment ensuring files and builds are up-to-date.
Site Administration & Incident Support
Performs specialized site logs and data gathering for issuing of permits, such as Maintenance Operation Protocol (MOPs) and scripts.
Identifies Single Points of Failure (SPOFs) and makes recommendations for solutions.
Responds to all on-site incidents, including failures, significant problems and delays.
Performs Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and make recommendations for solutions.
Supports the on-site staff during incidents.
Demonstrates and supports processes and procedures are followed and adhered to.
Work Orders & Additional Projects
Completes skilled work requests and circuit installations.
Performs advanced troubleshooting and maintenance of office equipment (if necessary); supports auxiliary equipment and machines with problem solving and repairs to avoid/minimize downtime.
Makes moderate changes to mechanical, electrical and specialized systems, as directed.
Carries out more complex infrastructure projects.
Supports life cycle maintenance/end of life. infrastructure projects and critical replacements.
May recommend infrastructure projects.
Collaboration
Collaborates with others to resolve difficult facility incidents.
Effectively collaborates within the department; may mentor team members on skilled maintenance activities.
Informs stakeholders of inventory needs to maintain optimal stock levels of critical parts and equipment, may support in coordinating processes for maintaining inventory.
Acts as a mentor to others in resolving incidents.

Job Title: Analytical Lead Appdev Growth Consultants Google Customer Solutions  Singapore
Job Description:
Product area
When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.

Additional job description
As a core part of Google Customer Solutions (GCS), AppDev is one of the fastest growing businesses in the Global Business Organization (GBO). AppDev works in the global Apps and Games ecosystem, helping them grow and expand their business across each region.
In this role, you will work on iOS and Android Apps and Games in Asia-Pacific to help them optimize their user acquisition strategy with Google Ads. You will deliver client engagements on data measurement and investigative consulting projects (e.g., pLTV, event selection, incrementality). You will help clients understand and improve the effectiveness of their advertising across digital platforms and across media. In addition, you will lead hypothesis-driven client analysis to surface actionable insights.

Qualifications
Job responsibilities
Build scalable solutions and measurement frameworks to help AppDev promoters and their customers accelerate their advertising business across Android, iOS, domestic and international markets through the power of data.
Collaborate and influence various cross-functional teams including Sales, Product, Strategy. Partner and identify new business opportunities, put thoughtful insights together and present those and drive decision-making.
Train promoters and customers with industry and investigative thought leadership by monitoring the latest trends and insights from developers and users, and by offering data-driven suggestions via supporting tools and presentations for high-level sales initiatives.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in a technical project management or a customer-facing role.
Preferred qualifications
Experience in running causal/incrementality study to measure impact.
Knowledge of Apps or Web attribution ecosystem, and SQL to provide key insights.
Understanding of machine learning methodologies including data cleansing, normalization, feature engineering, model training/validation and automation, statistical modeling and quantitative analysis techniques.
Ability to work with large data sets.
Ability to communicate in English and Vietnamese fluently in order to lead business and technical conversations with key clients in the Vietnam market.
Ability to work with limited guidance and provide actionable business insights.

Job Description:
Responsibilities
Solution Architecture: Design and architect end user computing solutions encompassing physical desktops, laptops, tablets (iPads), virtual desktops and think clients. Develop detailed technical specifications and deployment strategies.
Device Management: Implement and manage a variety of EUC devices including windows PCs, iPads, Thin Clients. Ensure efficient provisioning, configuration and lifecycle management.
Virtual Desktop Infrastructure: Lead the implementation and management of thin client and VDI solutions, including VMware Horizon. Optimize performance and ensure high availability.
Operating System Deployment: Oversee the deployment and management of operating systems (Windows 10/11) using tools such as MECM, Altiris, Intune and other device management solutions.
Migration Projects: Lead and manage complex migration projects involving transitions from on-premises to cloud-based solutions, upgrade of operating systems and migration of applications and user data across varies devices.
Automation and Scripting: Utilize scripting languages to automate provisioning, configuration and management tasks. Develop scripts for bulk deployments and device managements.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and analyze the performance of EUC environments. Implement optimization techniques to enhance system efficiency, reliability and user experience across all device.
Security and Compliance: Implement and manage security measures for EUC environments, including endpoints protection, encryption, secure access and compliance with organizational policies and industry regulations.
Technical leadership: Provide expert guidance and technical leadership on EUC technologies. Conduct design reviews, technical discussions, and lead cross-functional teams in implementing solutions.
Troubleshooting and Support: Address and resolve complex technical issues related to EUC devices and environments, perform root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
Documentation: Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including architecture diagrams, deployment guides, device management procedures and troubleshooting documentation. Ensure knowledge transfer to relevant teams.
Training and Mentoring: Provide training and mentorship to junior team members and end users on new technologies, device management practices and best practices.
Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned by supervisor.

Requirements
8+ years of experience in end-user computing, including significant experience in designing and implementing EUC solutions across a diverse range of devices and leading migration projects.
Operating systems: Extensive experience with Windows 10/11, iOS
VDI Solutions: Advanced knowledge of VMware Horizon, Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop, Thin clients
Device Management: Proficiency in managing desktops, laptops, thin clients using Microsoft End Point Manager (Intune), MECM, Altiris and Mobile Device Management Solutions.
Security: Experience with endpoint security solutions, encryption technologies and security best practices.

Job Description:
LMA is delighted to partner with an established Cybersecurity company looking to appoint a dynamic and results-driven Cybersecurity Scientist to join their Singapore branch.
This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated professional to play a pivotal role in the growth and success of their business.

Job Description:

We seek a highly skilled and experienced lead cybersecurity scientist to guide our cybersecurity product strategy and research initiatives and ensure the security of our companys products and infrastructure. This senior leadership role requires a deep understanding of the cybersecurity industry, hands-on experience in technical research, and the ability to drive innovation in security products.
Key Responsibilities:

Cybersecurity Product Strategy:
Collaborate with Product Teams to craft the companys cybersecurity product strategy and roadmap.
Continuously assess and adapt the product strategy to address new and evolving cybersecurity challenges.
Cybersecurity Research:
Lead Cybersecurity Engineers in conducting technical research to understand and forecast emerging cyber threats.
Develop and evaluate approaches to effectively address these threats.
Monitor global cybersecurity trends and integrate relevant findings into the product strategy and roadmap
Conduct internal product validations to ensure that our cybersecurity products are world-class.
Company Security:
Oversee the security of the companys products and infrastructure, ensuring compliance with industry standards and best practices.
Manage and maintain company security certifications such as ISO27001 and CSA STAR Level 2

Job Requirements:
Minimum 6 years of technical experience in cybersecurity, with a strong emphasis on research in industry.
Proven experience in using and managing a wide range of cybersecurity products, cybersecurity researchers, cybersecurity analysts or software engineers.
Technical experience in one or more of these areas: zero-day vulnerability research, incident response, forensics, reverse engineering exploits, manual penetration testing etc
Demonstrated ability to adapt to changing cybersecurity landscapes and incorporate new information into strategic planning.

Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Backend Development:
Design, develop, and maintain microservices architecture using .NET Core and .NET 8.
Implement event-driven architecture to enable seamless communication between microservices.
Utilize Entity Framework (EF) for efficient database interactions and management.
Containerize applications using Docker for scalability and deployment flexibility.
Apply Domain-Driven Design (DDD) principles to ensure clean and modular code architecture.
Implement OAuth for secure authentication and authorization.
Develop and enforce security best practices to safeguard sensitive data and systems.
Utilize AWS services such as S3, Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, etc., for backend development.
Develop RESTful APIs endpoints to facilitate communication between the frontend and backend.
Frontend Development:
Develop responsive and user-friendly web applications using React.js and Next.js.
Write unit tests using Jest to ensure code quality and reliability.
Create reusable UI components and maintain a consistent design using Storybook.
Collaborate closely with UX/UI designers to implement intuitive and visually appealing interfaces.
Troubleshoot and debug issues across the stack, ensuring smooth application operation.
Optimize application performance and scalability for a seamless user experience.
What we are looking for:
Proven experience as a Full Stack .NET Core Developer or similar role.
Strong proficiency in .NET Core, .NET 8, C#, and related backend technologies.
Experience building microservices architecture and implementing event-driven design patterns.
Proficiency in Entity Framework (EF) for database management.
Familiarity with Docker and containerization principles.
Knowledge of Domain-Driven Design (DDD) principles and their application in backend development.
Experience implementing OAuth for authentication and authorization.
Understanding of security best practices and their application in backend development.
Hands-on experience with AWS services such as S3, Lambda, API Gateway, DynamoDB, etc.
Proficiency in frontend technologies such as React.js, Next.js, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Experience writing unit tests using Jest and maintaining a design system with Storybook.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Preferably more than 5 years of experience as a full stack developer;
Experience working in both Unix and Windows operating environments are preferred.
AWS certification (e.g., AWS Certified Developer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect).
Experience with Node.js for server-side development.
Familiarity with NoSQL databases such as DynamoDB.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Understanding of Agile development methodologies.

Job Title: Senior Consultant  Sap Production Planning  Sg
Job Description:
Senior Consultant - SAP Production Planning  SG

Are you ready to unleash your potential?
At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.
We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on societys biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices.
Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals.
We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions.
Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!
Work you will do
This role sits within the SAP team of Deloitte Southeast Asia, which encompasses the SAP Module solutions respectively. As a leader of this group, you will drive the growth of our SAP business in the region and be responsible for the creation, sale and delivery of SAP solutions: Functional and Technical Design, SAP Application & Systems Development, SAP Business Transformation, etc.
Engage clients in workshops and interviews to analyze process and reporting requirements
Advise clients on industry/ cross-industry leading practices. Advise clients on SAP recommended processes and functions
Design target state SAP solutions for clients. Influence clients thinking in adopting leading/ standard practices while developing target state
Design and develop comprehensive business models within SAP SAC
Analyze application landscape to design interfaces to SAP solution
Perform SAP configuration and tests.
Lead the consultant and client teams through the implementation cycle including planning and execution of testing, migration and cutover.
Support change management execution by developing training material, delivering training and supporting users post cutover.
Develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders
What we are looking for
If you are someone with:
A good honors Degree, preferably at postgraduate level, in Information Technology, Business Information Systems, Business, Engineering, Mathematics or related disciplines.
Senior Consultant will require a minimum of 6 years of experience in SAP Production Planning Module, completed at least an end to end full life cycle of SAP Production Planning. Also have some team leading experiences would be a plus
Demonstrated success in multi-cultural work environment.
Sound understanding of business process, industry nuances and leading practices in area of focus
Ability to facilitate effective workshops to lead target state design.
Ability to lead teams
Demonstrated excellence in conceiving and executing SAP solution
Broad understanding of SAP design. Appreciation of digital enterprise and emerging technologies
Sound business acumen, teamwork and leadership qualities.
Willingness to work outside of office base and most of all
An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a pre-requisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment.
Due to volume of applications, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Please note that Deloitte will never reach out to you directly via messaging platforms to offer you employment opportunities or request for money or your personal information. Kindly apply for roles that you are interested in via this official Deloitte website.

Job Description:
As an Industry Analyst specializing in IT Security, you will be responsible for researching and analyzing industry trends, market dynamics, and competitive landscapes within the IT security and services sector. Your insights will inform product development, strategic planning, and client engagement. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our solutions meet market demands and address emerging threats.

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Market Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive research on IT security trends, technologies, and market developments. Analyze data to identify emerging threats, opportunities, and competitive intelligence.
Reporting and Documentation: Develop detailed reports, whitepapers, and presentations on industry trends, market forecasts, and competitive analysis. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with product management and development teams to align our security solutions with market needs. Support the development of strategic roadmaps and product/service go to market.
Client Engagement: Act as a subject matter expert for clients, offering insights on industry trends, threat landscapes, and best practices. Assist in the development of client-facing materials and presentations.
Competitive Analysis: Monitor and evaluate competitor activities, product offerings, and market positioning. Identify gaps and opportunities for differentiation.
Thought Leadership: Contribute to thought leadership initiatives, including blog posts, webinars, and industry conferences. Represent [Your Company Name] as an expert in IT security.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, sales, and analyst teams to ensure alignment on market needs and product strategy.
Author research, advisory and content marketing documents
Perform MarketScape reports (vendor comparisons)
Engage the client/prospect once a week
Support all CIS renewals in the quarter
Support business development for any consulting/CIS
Speak at client events, industry events and facilitate round tables/panel discussions
Perform advisory to senior leadership teams from security vendors/services providers
Support planning and P&L activities

Requirements:
The candidate must have a minimum of 4-6 years of relevant work experience in the IT/technology industry, IT/digital functional areas, or business/strategy/technology consulting, or in leading market research firms.
Has excellent written and verbal communications skills.
Delivering presentations to external clients.
Is well-connected in the technology industry.
Able to connect well with directors/VP executives across APAC region.
Has worked in a multi-cultural environment.
Able to work independently and collaboratively.
Able to work with tight timelines and multi-task/manage projects.
Able to adapt quickly to changing market dynamics and client expectations.
A positive attitude and willingness to learn and share.
Able to function in a fast-paced environment.

Job Description:
Our client is a well-established multinational corporation, serving as a one-stop communication provider in Southeast Asia. They offer comprehensive solutions and services to meet diverse business needs in the region.
They are seeking are seeking an experienced Channel Alliance Manager to drive business expansion across the APAC region through strategic technology alliances and distributors.
In this role, you will collaborate with sales, presales, marketing, and partner teams to promote IT System Integration products and solutions. Your primary focus will be on fostering strong partnerships with key technology providers and developing joint go-to-market campaigns that drive sales growth.

Key Responsibilities:
Manage and grow relationships with strategic technology partners (e.g., Cisco, Fortinet, CrowdStrike).
Collaborate with the Partner Program Team to create and execute partner campaigns.
Drive business success by working closely with sales, presales, and marketing teams.
Develop and implement business plans with strategic technology alliances.

Generate demand and accelerate sales opportunities to closure.

Regional experience in the APAC market, with knowledge of local business landscapes and distributors.
Business development experience, especially in managing partner programs and strategic alliances.
Strong collaboration and relationship-building skills.
Willingness to travel as needed.
This role offers a fantastic opportunity to lead strategic initiatives in a dynamic and growing market. If you have a strong track record of success in IT sales and channel partnerships, we want to hear from you!

Job Title: Content Solutions And Sponsorship Lead Large Customer Sales  Singapore
Job Description:
Product area
Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the worlds biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a birds eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.
Job description
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.
Additional job description
As the Content Solutions & Sponsorship lead, you are the link between YouTube and Sales. Your role is to turn product innovations into client solutions that enable our customers to get the most out of Googles advertising products. You will partner with Sales team members in building the strongest commercial strategy, and we equip customer-facing Googlers with essential product expertise. You will work on maximizing the YouTube Music opportunity, working on Festive Tent pole Moments, collaborating on scaled content innovations such as Roadblocks & Line Ups.
Qualifications
Job responsibilities
Partner with Video Specialists and Sales teams to establish strategy and grow Content Revenue (YouTube Select) at the local market level.
Lead awareness and training of the Content Proposition, ensure Sales excellence and reporting against lead lists.
Be the local Subject Matter Expert, identify Tentpole Content moments, develop narratives and lend pitch support for the top leads.
Support execution of Content Solution projects, introduce implementations tools and influence Product teams for long term impact.
Drive cross functional collaborations in local market (with local market stakeholders, YouTube Partnerships, Marketing, gTech and Media Planners) unlocking local Content Solutions opportunities for brands.
Minimum qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in digital media, sales, marketing, or product roles.
Experience working with digital organizations.
Experience identifying and recommending ways to improve product and customer strategy.
Experience working within the South East Asia markets.
Preferred qualifications
Experience and understanding of the wider media world, including communications planning, content strategy, publishing and media owner.
Experience developing and executing large sponsorship programs.
Understanding of the YouTube ecosystem (viewers, creators, advertisers) and products.
Demonstrated consulting skills, with the ability to successfully influence stakeholders at all levels.
Knowledge of the Content and Creator landscape.

Description of the Companys background
Xiaomi Corporation was founded in April 2010 and listed on the Main Board of the Hong
Kong Stock Exchange on July 9, 2018. Xiaomi is a consumer electronics and smart
manufacturing company with smartphones and smart hardware connected by an IoT
platform at its core.

Embracing our vision of Make friends with users and be the coolest company in the users
hearts, Xiaomi continuously pursues innovations, high-quality user experience and
operational eciency. The company relentlessly builds amazing products with honest prices
to let everyone in the world enjoy a better life through innovative technology.
Xiaomi is one of the world's leading smartphone companies. The companys market share in
terms of smartphone shipments ranked no. 2 globally in the second quarter of 2021. The
company has also established the worlds leading consumer AIoT (AI+IoT) platform, with
374.5 million smart devices connected to its platform (excluding smartphones and laptops)
as of 31 March 31, 2021, excluding smartphones and laptops. Xiaomi products are present
in more than 100 countries and regions around the world.

Job Description:
Job Summary
You will be working with our client in the financial industry. As a Project Manager for Cloud Migration, you will lead the end-to-end migration of on-premises infrastructure and applications from on-prem to AWS Cloud. You will work closely with solution architects, cross-functional teams, including IT, business stakeholders, and cloud architects, to ensure successful planning, execution, and delivery of cloud migration projects. Your role will involve managing timelines, budgets, resources, and risks, ensuring that projects meet business objectives and comply with security and regulatory requirements.
Responsibilities
Plan, coordinate, and manage cloud migration projects from on-premises to AWS, ensuring that project objectives, timelines, and budgets are met.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables in alignment with business requirements.
Work closely with solution architects, cloud architects, infrastructure teams, and vendors to execute the migration strategy.
Identify and mitigate risks and issues throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations.
Manage the development and execution of migration roadmaps, including application, database, and data migration.
Lead project teams in the identification of dependencies, bottlenecks, and resource needs to ensure timely delivery.
Ensure compliance with AWS cloud security standards, policies, and best practices.
Communicate project status, risks, and mitigation plans to senior management and stakeholders.
Monitor post-migration performance and ensure operational stability and optimization of AWS cloud infrastructure.
Requirements
Bachelors degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 8 years of experience in managing IT projects, preferably experience in GCC migration.
Strong knowledge of AWS cloud services, including EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, IAM, and security best practices.
Experience in managing large-scale infrastructure migration projects, particularly from on-premises to cloud environments.
Proven track record in managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders and dependencies.
Strong understanding of Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies.
Experience with cloud automation tools, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform, CloudFormation) is a plus.
Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified Developer) will be an added advantage.
If you are interested in this role and would like to discuss the opportunity further please click apply now or email Chew Kai-Xinn at kaixinnchew@morganmckinley.com for more information.
Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a reply within 14 days please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted.
